intro: Seguieria coriacea, commonly known as the rough-seeded senna, is a shrub native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is adapted to dry environments, featuring thick, leathery leaves that reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Seguieria coriacea is also valued for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soils.
